page.title: 12Two Ombersley Shops
page.content: {THE GALLERIES.}The lady who owned The Galleries told us about her craft shop and tea rooms. It became a shop in 1945 and was first a grocers then a bakers. The tea room attached used to be a priest's house and is very old.We noted some prices: a picture cost Â£50, a china thimble Â£21 and an embroidered cushion Â£50. People come to shop from a 40 mile radius. It is closed on Sundays and Mondays. {T.H.CHECKETTS.}Most people who shop at T.H.Checketts, the butcher, come from Ombersley.The business was established in 1830 and has been owned by Checketts since 1925.The most popular meat sold is beef.These are some of their prices:chicken,89p per lb,lamb's liver 99p per lb,mince Â£1.35 per lb,pork sausages,84p per lb.The busiest day is Friday because people buy their meat for the weekend.
